alert.note: Alert for Eastern Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued August 30 at 5:48AM EDT until September 01 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THURSDAY TO 6 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 7 to 11 feet expected in the surf zone. * WHERE...Eastern Currituck County. * WHEN...From 10 AM Thursday to 6 AM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Large breaking waves of 7 to 11 ft will result in dangerous surf conditions. Do not enter or approach the water due to the risk of being swept away. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The rip risk will remain high through at least late week.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
